title: Core Feats System
description: Complete data for all general feats and skill feats with prerequisites and benefits

rules.skillFeatRestriction: When gaining skill feats, must select general feats with the skill trait
rules.generalFeatAccess: General feats without skill trait only available during general feat progression

nonSkillGeneral.name: Adopted Ancestry
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: Choose an ancestry whose creatures can have children with your ancestry. You gain access to ancestry feats from that ancestry.
nonSkillGeneral.special: You can gain only ancestry feats from the chosen ancestry

nonSkillGeneral.name: Armor Proficiency
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You become trained in light armor. If you were already trained in light armor, you become trained in medium armor. If you were already trained in medium armor, you become trained in heavy armor.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Can be taken multiple times to progress through armor types

nonSkillGeneral.name: Breath Control
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You can hold your breath for 25 times as long as usual before suffocating. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against inhaled threats, such as inhaled poisons.

nonSkillGeneral.name: Canny Acumen
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: Choose Fortitude saves, Reflex saves, Will saves, or Perception. You become an expert in your choice.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Can be taken multiple times for different saves/Perception

nonSkillGeneral.name: Diehard
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: It takes more to kill you than most. You die from the dying condition at dying 5, rather than dying 4.

nonSkillGeneral.name: Fast Recovery
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You regain twice as many Hit Points from resting. Each time you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing disease or poison, you reduce its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent disease or poison.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Applies to both short and long rests

nonSkillGeneral.name: Feather Step
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You can Step into difficult terrain.
nonSkillGeneral.actionEconomy: Modifies Step action to work in difficult terrain

nonSkillGeneral.name: Fleet
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You move more quickly on foot. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

nonSkillGeneral.name: Incredible Initiative
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You react more quickly than others can. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.

nonSkillGeneral.name: Pet
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You have a pet, most likely a dog, cat, bird, or other small animal. Your pet is trained to do a few tricks but isn't suitable for combat.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Pet is a minion but cannot be used in combat

nonSkillGeneral.name: Ride
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: When you Command an Animal you're mounted on, you automatically succeed instead of needing to attempt a check, unless the GM determines the animal is spooked or unruly.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Only applies to mounts you are riding

nonSkillGeneral.name: Shield Block
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You can use a shield to ward off some attacks. You gain the Shield Block reaction.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Reduces damage but may damage shield

nonSkillGeneral.name: Toughness
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You can take more punishment than most. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. When you have the dying condition, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 10 + your dying condition value, instead of 11 + your dying condition value.
nonSkillGeneral.scaling: Hit point bonus increases with level

nonSkillGeneral.name: Weapon Proficiency
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You become trained in all martial weapons. If you were already trained in all martial weapons, you become trained in one advanced weapon or one other weapon group's martial weapons.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Can be taken multiple times for additional weapon access

nonSkillGeneral.name: Ancestral Paragon
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: Whether through instinct, study, or magic, you feel a deeper connection to your ancestry. You gain a 1st-level ancestry feat.
nonSkillGeneral.special: Must meet prerequisites of chosen ancestry feat

nonSkillGeneral.name: Prescient Planner
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You're always prepared. You can take a number of actions equal to your level to pull out useful mundane items, as if you had purchased them in advance.
nonSkillGeneral.uses: Per day equal to character level

nonSkillGeneral.name: Untrained Improvisation
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth. Your proficiency bonus to untrained skill checks is equal to half your level instead of +0.
nonSkillGeneral.scaling: Bonus increases as character level increases

nonSkillGeneral.name: Incredible Investiture
nonSkillGeneral.benefits: You can invest more magic items. You can invest up to 12 magic items instead of 10.

universalSkill.name: Assurance
universalSkill.benefits: Choose a skill you're trained in. You can forgo rolling a skill check for that skill to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus.
universalSkill.special: Can be taken multiple times for different skills

universalSkill.name: Dubious Knowledge
universalSkill.benefits: You're a treasure trove of information, but not all of it is reliable. When you fail a Recall Knowledge check, you learn both a true piece of information and a false piece of information, but you don't know which is which.

universalSkill.name: Quick Identification
universalSkill.benefits: You can Identify Magic swiftly. You take only 1 minute when using Identify Magic. If you're a master, it takes a 3-action activity. If you're legendary, it takes 1 action.
universalSkill.scaling: Time required decreases with proficiency rank

universalSkill.name: Recognize Spell
universalSkill.benefits: You can use a reaction to identify a spell as it's being cast. This uses the same skills as Identify Magic.

universalSkill.name: Skill Training
universalSkill.benefits: You become trained in the skill of your choice.
universalSkill.special: Can be taken multiple times for different skills

universalSkill.name: Trick Magic Item
universalSkill.benefits: You can attempt to activate magic items you normally can't activate. Use the skill associated with the item's magic tradition.
universalSkill.special: DC = item level + 10 + item's mental ability modifier

universalSkill.name: Automatic Knowledge
universalSkill.benefits: You know basic facts off the top of your head. Once per round, you can use Recall Knowledge as a free action, but you must use Assurance on the check.
universalSkill.special: Must use Assurance for the check

universalSkill.name: Magical Shorthand
universalSkill.benefits: Learning spells comes easily to you. If you're an expert in a magical tradition's associated skill, you take half as much time to learn spells of that tradition, and if you're legendary, you can learn them at normal Speed by paying half the cost.

acrobatics.name: Cat Fall
acrobatics.benefits: Your catlike reflexes allow you to fall from great heights with ease. Treat falls as 10 feet shorter. If you're an expert in Acrobatics, treat falls as 25 feet shorter. If you're a master, treat them as 50 feet shorter.

acrobatics.name: Quick Squeeze
acrobatics.benefits: You can Squeeze 5 feet per round (10 feet on a critical success). If you're legendary in Acrobatics, you can Squeeze at full Speed.

acrobatics.name: Steady Balance
acrobatics.benefits: You can keep your balance easily. Whenever you roll a success using the Balance action, you get a critical success instead.
acrobatics.special: Success becomes critical success on Balance checks

acrobatics.name: Nimble Crawl
acrobatics.benefits: You can crawl swiftlyâ€”up to half your Speed, rather than 5 feet. If you're a master in Acrobatics, you can crawl at full Speed.

acrobatics.name: Kip Up
acrobatics.benefits: You stand up from lying prone. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

athletics.name: Combat Climber
athletics.benefits: Your techniques let you fight as you climb. You're not off-guard while Climbing and can Climb with one hand occupied.

athletics.name: Hefty Hauler
athletics.benefits: You can carry more than your frame implies. Increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 2.

athletics.name: Quick Jump
athletics.benefits: You can use High Jump and Long Jump as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don't perform the initial Stride.
athletics.actionEconomy: High Jump and Long Jump become 1 action instead of 2

athletics.name: Titan Wrestler
athletics.benefits: You can wrestle creatures larger than yourself. You can use Athletics to Grapple a creature up to two sizes larger than you.
athletics.special: Normally can only grapple creatures up to one size larger

athletics.name: Underwater Marauder
athletics.benefits: You've learned to fight underwater. You are not off-guard while in water, and you don't take the usual penalties for using a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in water.

crafting.name: Alchemical Crafting
crafting.benefits: You can use the Craft activity to create alchemical items. When you select this feat, you immediately add the formulas for four common 1st-level alchemical items to your formula book.
crafting.special: Grants access to alchemical item crafting + 4 formulas

crafting.name: Quick Repair
crafting.benefits: You take 1 minute to Repair an item. If you're a master in Crafting, it takes 3 actions. If you're legendary, it takes 1 action.

crafting.name: Snare Crafting
crafting.benefits: You can use the Craft activity to create snares. When you select this feat, you add the formulas for four common 1st-level snares to your formula book.
crafting.special: Grants access to snare crafting + 4 snare formulas

crafting.name: Specialty Crafting
crafting.benefits: Your training focused on a particular kind of item. Select one of the specialties listed below; you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Crafting checks to Craft items of that type.
crafting.special: Can be taken multiple times for different specialties

medicine.name: Battle Medicine
medicine.benefits: You can patch up yourself or an adjacent ally, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for Treat Wounds, but the target is then temporarily immune to your Battle Medicine for 1 day.
medicine.actionEconomy: 1 action to use Medicine in combat
medicine.special: Creates separate immunity from Treat Wounds

medicine.name: Continual Recovery
medicine.benefits: You enable a patient to recover from wounds for an hour. Patients you treat with Treat Wounds gain immunity for only 10 minutes instead of 1 hour.
medicine.special: Reduces Treat Wounds immunity from 1 hour to 10 minutes

medicine.name: Ward Medic
medicine.benefits: You've studied how to care for multiple patients. When you use Treat Wounds, you can treat up to two targets. If you're a master in Medicine, you can treat up to four targets, and if you're legendary, you can treat up to eight targets.

levelRestrictions.description: Feat level determines minimum character level
levelRestrictions.rule: Cannot take feats above character level

skillFeatRules.traitRequirement: Must have 'skill' trait when gained as skill feat
skillFeatRules.generalFeatException: General feats without 'skill' trait only during general feat progression

multipleSelectionRules.assurance: Can take multiple times for different skills
multipleSelectionRules.terrainFeats: Can take for different terrain types
